required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Oncolytic Virus (OVV-01) Injection in the Treatment of Patients With Advanced Solid Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: A Single-arm, Open-label Clinical Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability and Preliminary Efficacy of Oncolytic Virus (OVV-01) Injection Combined With or Without Immune Checkpoint Inhibitors in the Treatment of Patients With Advanced Solid Tumors

lead_sponsor.agency: North China Petroleum Bureau General Hospital

clinical_study.source: North China Petroleum Bureau General Hospital

detailed_description.textblock:
Phase Ia:
This is a prospective, multicenter, open-label, single-arm investigator-initiated clinical study to evaluate the safety and efficacy of intratumoral injection of OVV-01 injection in patients with advanced solid tumors.
This study plans to enroll in 1 ~ 3 study sites nationwide about 9 ~ 18 patients with advanced solid tumors for whom the standard treatment failed and currently no standard treatment is available or standard treatment is not suitable due to medical reasons, to conduct a phase Ia study, i.e., the First in Human (FIH) trial of OVV-01 injection, using the traditional "3 + 3" approach for dose gradient exploration.
Phase Ib:
This is a prospective, multi-center, open-label, single-arm investigator-initiated clinical study to evaluate the safety and efficacy of intratumoral injection of OVV-01 injection combined with immune checkpoint inhibitors in patients with advanced solid tumors.
This study plans to enroll in 1 ~ 3 study sites nationwide about 12 ~ 24 patients with advanced solid tumors for whom the standard treatment failed and currently no standard treatment is available or standard treatment is not suitable due to medical reasons, to conduct a phase Ib study, using the traditional "3 + 3" approach and based on the phase Ia results, 2 dose gradients of OVV-01 are used in combination with pembrolizumab and atezolizumab, respectively, to explore the efficacy and safety.
Phase Ic:
This is a prospective, multi-center, open-label, single-arm investigator-initiated clinical study to evaluate the safety and efficacy of intratumoral injection of OVV-01 injection combined with immune checkpoint inhibitors in patients with advanced solid tumors.
This study plans to enroll in 1 ~ 3 study sites nationwide about 15 ~ 20 patients with advanced solid tumors for whom the standard treatment failed and currently no standard treatment is available or standard treatment is not suitable due to medical reasons, to conduct a phase Ic study.

primary_outcome.measure: to define the MTD of OVV-01
primary_outcome.description: to define the maximum tolerated dose (MTD) of intratumoral administration of OVV-01 injection in humans with malignant tumors.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with treatment-related adverse events as assessed by CTCAE v5.0
primary_outcome.description: to evaluate the number of Grade III and above side effects assessed by CTCAE v5.0 for patients who received intratumoral administration of OVV-01 injection combined with immune checkpoint inhibitors pembrolizumab (anti-PD-1 monoclonal antibody) or atezolizumab (anti-PD-L1 monoclonal antibody) in patients with advanced solid tumors.

secondary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the efficacy assessed by the RECISTv1.1 of OVV-01
secondary_outcome.description: to evaluate preliminary efficacy assessed by the RECISTv1.1 of intratumoral administration of OVV-01 injection in the treatment of patients with advanced solid tumors

secondary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the efficacy assessed by the RECISTv1.1 of OVV-01 with ICIs
secondary_outcome.description: to evaluate the preliminary efficacy assessed by the RECISTv1.1 of intratumoral administration of OVV-01 injection combined with immune checkpoint inhibitors pembrolizumab (anti-PD-1 monoclonal antibody) or atezolizumab (anti-PD-L1 monoclonal antibody) in patients with advanced solid tumors

arm_group.arm_group_label: Oncolytic virus (OVV-01) injection for patients with advanced solid tumors
arm_group.description: Oncolytic virus (OVV-01) injection combined with or without immune checkpoint inhibitors in the treatment of patients with advanced solid tumors.

intervention.description: intratumoral injection of OVV-01 with or without immune checkpoint inhibitors
intervention.arm_group_label: Oncolytic virus (OVV-01) injection for patients with advanced solid tumors

overall_official.affiliation: North China Petroleum Bureau General Hospital

facility.name: North China Petroleum Bureau General Hospital

patient_data.ipd_description: After the publication of this study, we could share the IPD. However, this sharing is limited to academic research. Person to be contacted: Study Chair-Professor Qiang Lin; Contact information:billhappy001@163.com
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: After the publication of this study IPD could be shared.The sharing time is set for 5 years
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: For the purpose of academic research only
